newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey signs technology deal with Indonesia.
newsitem.headline: Turkey signs technology deal with Indonesia.

text.p: Turkey and Indonesia signed cooperation agreements in technology and aviation on Tuesday at a development conference in Istanbul.
The aviation accord, worth $2 million, involves the assembly of military aircraft in Turkey using parts from Indonesia.
The conference, attended by delegates from seven developing Moslem countries, was chaired by Turkey's Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan.
The agreements were signed by Indonesian technology minister Jusuf Habibie and Turkish minister of state Sabri Tekir.

Habibie said the two countries' common Islamic culture was significant in the signing of the deal and added that he hoped cooperation in the field of technology would lift the volume of trade from the current level of $200 million to $2 billion.
Erbakan said in his speech at the conference: "It is only if we unite that we can surmount obstacles faster and more easily. Of course this will be done with those who are closer to us."
Erbakan, modern Turkey's first Islamist leader, visited Indonesia last month as part of a tour aimed at devoloping relations and economic ties with other Moslem countries.
Opposition parties voiced strong criticism of this tour and last week put forward a censure motion following Erbakan's visit to Libya shortly after the tour. Parliament rejected the motion.
